Nicholas Jamerson | website = }} '''Sundy Best''' is an American country duo formed by Nicholas Jamerson and Kris Bentley from [[Prestonsburg, Kentucky]].{{cite web |url=http://www.cmt.com/artists/sundy-best/ |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130430062304/http://www.cmt.com/artists/sundy-best |url-status=dead |archive-date=April 30, 2013 |title=Sundy Best |work=CMT artist }} Their music is a blend of country, Appalachian folk, [[Bluegrass music|bluegrass]], rock, soul, and R&B.{{cite web |url= http://www.allmusic.com/artist/sundy-best-mn0003134831/biography |title=Sundy Best |work=Allmusic.com }} They released their album ''Bring Up the Sun'' in 2014. The duo announced their break-up in March 2018.{{cite news |url=http://www.kentucky.com/entertainment/ent-columns-blogs/copious-notes/article204105469.html|title=Sundy Best announces breakup. Members will pursue other projects|first= Rich |last= Copley|date=March 8, 2018 |work=Lexington Herald-Leader }} Since the breakup, Jamerson continued his musical career as a solo artist. In October 2020, the duo announced that they would be reuniting. ==Origin== Sundy Best was formed by two friends since elementary school, Nick Jamerson and Kris Bentley, from [[Prestonsburg]] in Eastern Kentucky.{{cite web |url=http://www.cmtedge.com/2013/08/26/sundy-best-make-an-impression-with-moving-home/ |title=Sundy Best Make an Impression With Moving "Home" |author= Chris Parton |date=August 26, 2013 |work=CMT Edge }} Both were athletes in college, with Jamerson playing football while at [[University of Pikeville]] where he studied history, and Bentley played basketball at [[Centre College]] in [[Danville, Kentucky|Danville]] where he studied English. They formed a duo after college, and moved to [[Lexington, Kentucky]] in August 2010.{{cite web |url=http://www.sundybest.net/home/biography/ |title=biography |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140128075511/http://www.sundybest.net/home/biography/|archive-date=January 28, 2014 }} Jamerson performed as the lead vocalist and played the guitar, with Bentley on the [[cajón]] drum.{{cite web |url=http://ae-lane-report.s3.amazonaws.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/05/BG-Lex-Spring-2013.pdf |title=Putting Their "Best" Foot Forward |author=Ester Marr |work=BG – A Way of Life |publisher=The Lane Report }} Their name referred to the way they pronounce "Sunday best", their best clothing worn in church where they began playing music together on Sundays during their senior year in high school. ==Music career== In their first year as a duo, Sundy Best produced an album, ''Tales, Lies and Exaggerations'', which was a demo recorded at home.{{cite web |url=http://medicalleader.org/pmc_news.html?id=3815§ion= |title=Sundy Best to perform in Pikeville: July 13 show first since new album |work=Medical Leader |date=July 13, 2012 }} In December 2011, they raised $15,000 through the crowd-sourcing website [[Kickstarter]] to fund their first studio-recorded album.{{cite web |url=http://www.lanereport.com/20865/2013/04/sundy-best-climbing-cmt-charts/ |title= Lexington's Sundy Best climbing country music video charts |author1=Lorie Hailey |author2=Esther Marr |date=April 24, 2013 |work= The Lane Report }}{{cite web |url=http://kykernel.com/2012/03/25/sundy-best-plays-for-kentucky-crowd/ |title=Sundy Best plays for Kentucky crowd |date=March 25, 2012 |author=Alex Lovan|work=Kentucky Kernel}} The album, titled ''Door Without a Screen'', was released in the summer of 2012. They were then signed to the [[E1 Music]] music label which released a deluxe version of the album on August 27, 2013.{{cite web |url=http://us.eonemusic.com/news-and-events/kentucky%E2%80%99s-hottest-new-duo,-sundy-best,-inks-deal |title=Kentucky's hottest new duo, Sundy Best, inks deal with Entertainment One Music |publisher=eOne Music |date=July 22, 2013 }} ===2014: ''Bring Up the Sun'' and ''Salvation City''=== Sundy Best recorded their next album, ''Bring Up the Sun'', which was produced by RS Field. The album features 15 songs, including remakes of previously recorded songs, "Home," "Lilly" and "These Days."{{cite web |url= http://medicalleader.org/pmc_news.html?id=5997§ion=Community%20News |title=A Conversation with Sundy Best |author= Mary Meadows |date= 2014-02-28 |work=Medical Leader }} The video for "These Days" was released on 11 November 2013.{{cite news
